title: Electrophysiology-template template schema
description: Electrophysiology-template template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

propertyDescriptions.probe-element: Probes are physical devices used for recording the electrophysiological data. They can be permanently implanted (chronic recordings) or inserted just for the recording (acute recordings).
propertyDescriptions.electrode-element: Electrodes describe the points of electrodes to the tissue used for recording electrophysiological signals.
propertyDescriptions.acquisiton-system-element: Information about the hardware and software of the data acquisition system.
propertyDescriptions.channel-element1: Channels are virtual sources of recorded signals. These might be of neuronal origin (e.g. online filtered LFP signals) or generated by the recording setup (e.g. synchronization signals, behavioral signals, etc).
propertyDescriptions.in2pb-header: Header to be used for metadata templates created for In2PB projects.
propertyDescriptions.electrophysiology-header: Header with instructions for the electrophysiology metadata.
propertyDescriptions.free-text-field: A free text element to allow the user to provide any additional information.

items.title: probe-element field schema
items.description: probe-element field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

propertyDescriptions.probeHemisphere: Brain hemisphere where probe was located in.
propertyDescriptions.associatedBrainRegionID: Identifier of the associated brain region based on BIRNLEX ontology.
propertyDescriptions.associatedBrainRegion: Textual indication of the location of the probe in the brain.
propertyDescriptions.associatedBrainRegionQualityType: The method used to identify the associated brain region (estimated|proof) depending on anatomical pictures proofing the location or indirect estimation of the location.
propertyDescriptions.referenceAtlas: Reference atlas used for associated brain region
propertyDescriptions.probeX: Probe position along the global coordinate system x-axis.
propertyDescriptions.probeY: Probe position along the global coordinate system y-axis.
propertyDescriptions.probeZ: Probe position along the global coordinate system z-axis.
propertyDescriptions.probeManufacturer: Manufacturer of the probe system, eg., ‘opnephys’,’blackrock’, etc.
propertyDescriptions.probeDeviceSerialNumber: Manufacturer provided serial number of the probe.
propertyDescriptions.probeDepth: Physical depth of the probe in mm, e.g. 0.3. This dimension should be omitted or set to 0 for two-dimensional (shank-type) probes. This dimension corresponds to the z’ axis of the Euler transformation defined by alpha, beta and gamma rotations values below.
propertyDescriptions.probeWidth: Physical width of the probe in mm, e.g. 5. This dimension corresponds to the x’ axis of the Euler transformation defined by alpha, beta and gamma rotations values below.
propertyDescriptions.probeHeight: Physical width of the probe in mm, e.g. 5. This dimension corresponds to the y’ axis of the Euler transformation defined by alpha, beta and gamma rotations values below.
propertyDescriptions.probeID: Unique identifier for each electrophysiological recording probe that is referenced in the dataset.
propertyDescriptions.probeType: Type of probe used – Utah array, laminar, single tetrode, etc.
propertyDescriptions.probeCoordinateReferencePoint: Point of the probe that is described by the probe coordinates and on which the alpha, beta and gamma rotations are applied
propertyDescriptions.probeAlphaRotation: Euler angle in degree to match probe extension dimensions (width, height, depth) to global x, y, z coordinates
propertyDescriptions.probeBetaRotation: Euler angle in degree to match probe extension dimensions (width, height, depth) to global x, y, z coordinates.
propertyDescriptions.probeGammaRotation: Euler angle in degree to match probe extension dimensions (width, height, depth) to global x, y, z coordinates.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeCount: Number of miscellaneous analog electrodes for auxiliary signals (e.g. 2)
propertyDescriptions.probeMaterial: A textual description of the base material of the probe.

items.title: electrode-element field schema
items.description: electrode-element field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

propertyDescriptions.electrodeID: Unique identifier for the electrode, to match and be referenced in channel description.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeHemisphere: Brain hemisphere where the electrode was located.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeLocation: Textual indication of the location of the electrode (e.g. cortical layer 3, ca1, etc)
propertyDescriptions.electrodeX: Recorded position along the local x-axis relative to the probe origin and rotation.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeY: Recorded position along the local y-axis relative to the probe origin and rotation.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeZ: Recorded position along the local z-axis relative to the probe origin and rotation.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeImpedance: Impedance of the electrode or pipette (pipette_resistance). This can be a single value or a list of two values indicating a value range. It must be in kOhm
propertyDescriptions.electrodeShape: Description of the shape of the electrode, e.g. square, circle, etc.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeSize: Size of the electrode, e.g. non-insulated surface area or length of non-insulated cable.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeInsulationMaterial: Material used for insulation around the electrode.
propertyDescriptions.electrodeProbeID: Identifier to specify which shank of the probe the electrode is present. Alternatively, electrode probe identifier could be used here.
propertyDescriptions.shankID: Id to specify which shank of the probe the electrode is on. This is useful for spike sorting when the electrodes are on a multi-shank probe.

channel-element1.title: Channel-element element schema
channel-element1.description: Channel-element element schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

propertyDescriptions.channelID: Identifier for the channel, to be referenced in the data files.
propertyDescriptions.channelType: Type of the channel, e.g. Neural signal, digital trial events, synchronization pulses, etc
propertyDescriptions.channelUnit: Physical unit of the value represented in this channel.
propertyDescriptions.samplingFrequency: Sampling rate of the channel in Hz.
propertyDescriptions.channelDescription: Brief free-text description of the channel, or other information of interest.
propertyDescriptions.hardwareFilters: List of hardware filters (amplifiers) applied, details to be referenced from recording setup metadata for electrophysiology.
propertyDescriptions.softwareFilters: List of temporal software filters applied, details to be referenced from recording setup metadata for electrophysiology.
propertyDescriptions.notchFilters: List of notch filters applied, e.g. low_frequency, high_frequency, etc.
propertyDescriptions.channelStatusDescription: Freeform text description of noise or artifact affecting data quality on the channel.
propertyDescriptions.channelGain: Amplification factor applied from signal detection at the contact to the signal stored in the data file in dB.
propertyDescriptions.channelTimeReference: Reference channel used for time alignment of signals.
propertyDescriptions.channelTimeOffset: Time shift between signal of this channel to the reference channel.
propertyDescriptions.channelReference: Contact used as physical reference, e.g. contact identifier, physical location (subdural, chamber screw).
propertyDescriptions.channelGround: Information on the ground, e.g. Chamber screw, head post, ear clip, etc
propertyDescriptions.channelElectrodeID: Identifier for the electrode for a electrode based channel. Not applicable for non-contact related signal.
propertyDescriptions.channelLabel: Human readable identifier for non-contact related signal, e.g. Daq internal synchronization signals, behavioral signals, behavioral cues, etc.
propertyDescriptions.dataStreamID: Data stream of the recording the signal.
propertyDescriptions.channelStatus: Data quality observed on the channel (good/bad). A channel is considered bad if its data quality is compromised by excessive noise. Description of noise type SHOULD be provided in channelStatusDescription.

in2pb-header.title: in2pb-header field schema
in2pb-header.description: in2pb-header field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

_ui._content:
In2PrimateBrains Metadata Template

The template here aims to allow the researchers to contribute structured metadata describing their experiments intuitively using a form-based and spreadsheet like interface. This in turns enhances the findability, accessibility, interoperability, and reusability (FAIR) of your contributed datasets.

This metadata template was developed based on existing data standards and minimum reporting guidelines by the research team at the Ludwig-Maximilians-Universität München (LMU) and the German Neuroinformatics Node. The template was built as a part of the In2PrimateBrains Project, funded by MSCA-ITN-H2020 Grant Number 956669.

The template was built with the Center for Expanded Data Annotation and Retrieval (CEDAR) Workbench.

If you need any clarification about this form or if you're interested in contributing, please reach out to Reema Gupta (reema.gupta@lmu.de).

Tips for using this form:

  1. To see the description of the field, hover the cursor on
  2. There may be too many items in the drop-down menu for fields assigned with ontological support. Please enter the first few letters of your desired value and wait for a few seconds. The form will attempt to autocomplete your entry with standardized vocabulary.
  3. In the top-right corner, you can use the “Copy” button  to duplicate the field or element, or the “Toggle View” button  to switch to a tabular spreadsheet-like view for metadata entry. This applies to fields or elements that allow multiple entries.
  4. If the information is not available or is not applicable, leave the field blank.
  5. Use the free text field at the end of the template to provide any other additional information that you may want to convey.

in2pb-header.schema:description: Header to be used for metadata templates created for In2PB projects.

electrophysiology-header.title: electrophysiology-header field schema
electrophysiology-header.description: electrophysiology-header field schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

_ui._content:
Electrophysiology Metadata Template

The purpose of this template is to provide the metadata for about the electrophysiology data, if included in the dataset. Some metadata fields here are based on the brain imaging data structure (BIDS) specifications extension to microelectrode electrophysiology (under development).

Please note the pre-specified physical units for the quantitative fields.

This template is further divided into 4 different sections:

  1. Probe Metadata: This section provides metadata about the probes that record electrophysiological data. Probes here refer to physical devices used for recording. These could be acutely implanted or chronically implanted.
  2. Electrode Metadata: This section provides metadata about the electrodes associated with the probes defined above. Electrodes here are defined as the point of contact between the probe and the animal tissue.
  3. Channels Metadata: This section provides metadata about the channels of the recorded signals. These signals might be of neuronal origin (e.g. online filtered LFP) or generated by the recording setup (e.g. synchronization signals, behavioural signals, etc.). The channel type field is to be used to specify this. The channel unit field is mandatory, use the most appropriate selection (e.g. count unit, millivolt, etc). Use the value, “none of the above” if none of the listed units are applicable, and use the free text field at the end to specify and describe it.
  4. DAQ Metadata: This section is used to provide metadata about the data acquisition system setup used to record the electrophysiological data.
